title: Abstract Wiki Frame Schema: Product / Brand
description: JSON schema for the ProductBrandFrame semantic structure used for commercial products and brands.

frame_type.description: Stable frame identifier; must be "entity.product_brand" for ProductBrandFrame instances.

main_entity.description: The product or brand entity this frame describes, typically mirroring semantics.types.Entity (id, name, entity_type, extra, etc.).

owner_entity.description: Optional owning or parent organization, e.g. the company that manufactures or owns the product/brand. Entity-like object.

product_type_lemmas.description: Lemma-like labels for the type of product (e.g. "soft_drink", "smartphone", "running_shoe"). These are language-neutral keys.

brand_lemmas.description: Lemma-like labels for brand names or brand families associated with the product (e.g. "coca_cola", "iphone").

market_segment_lemmas.description: Lemma-like labels describing market segment or positioning (e.g. "premium", "budget", "mid_range", "sportswear").

launch_event.description: Optional Event-like object representing the launch or introduction, typically mirroring semantics.types.Event (id, event_type, time, location, participants, properties, extra).

launch_time.description: Optional TimeSpan-like object for when the product/brand was first introduced.

start_year.description: Approximate start year for the launch.

end_year.description: Optional end year if the launch is represented as a range.

approximate.description: Whether the time span is approximate.

extra.description: Optional additional metadata for the time span.

launch_location.description: Optional Location-like object for where the product/brand was first launched (e.g. country, city, market).

regions_of_sale.description: Zero or more Location-like objects representing regions/markets where the product is/was sold.

items.description: Location-like object, typically mirroring semantics.types.Location (id, name, kind, extra, etc.).

discontinued_time.description: Optional TimeSpan-like object describing when the product/brand was discontinued, if applicable.

start_year.description: Approximate start year for the discontinuation period (often the discontinuation year).

end_year.description: Optional end year for the discontinuation period.

approximate.description: Whether the time span is approximate.

extra.description: Optional additional metadata for the discontinuation time span.

attributes.description: Open-ended attribute map for additional structured facts about the product or brand (e.g. technical specs, variants, sizes, flavours). Keys should be strings.

extra.description: Free-form metadata bag for provenance, debug info, or original-source fields that are not directly interpreted by NLG.
